TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE and GPE . They are the father , mother and sister of PERSON , who was shot and killed during the demonstrations on the fringes of the GCARDINAL summit in Genoa in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and DATE the GCARDINAL summit was held in GPE . Numerous “ anti - globalisation ” demonstrations were staged in the city and substantial security measures were put in place by the NORP authorities . Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE , the prefect of ORG was authorised to deploy military personnel to ensure public safety in connection with the summit . In addition , the part of the city where the GCARDINAL were meeting ( the historic centre ) was designated as a “ red zone ” and cordoned off by means of a metal fence . As a result , only residents and persons working in the area were allowed access . Access to the port was prohibited and the airport was closed to traffic . The red zone was contained within a yellow zone , which in turn was surrounded by a white ( normal ) zone .

CARDINAL . The service instructions of DATE were issued by the officer in command of the law - enforcement agencies DATE before PERSON death . They sum up the priorities of the law - enforcement agencies as follows : establishing a line of defence within the red zone , with the task of repelling rapidly any attempt to break through ; establishing a line of defence within the yellow zone to deal with any incidents , taking account of the position of the demonstrators in various locations and of actions perpetrated by more extremist elements ; putting in place public - order measures on the streets concerned by the demonstrations , bearing in mind the risk of violence encouraged by the presence of crowds of people .

CARDINAL . The parties agreed as to the fact that the service instructions of DATE amended the plans hitherto established regarding the deployment of the available means and resources , in order to enable the law - enforcement agencies to counter effectively any attempt to enter the red zone by participants in the demonstration of the Tute Bianche ( “ White overalls ” ) which had been announced and authorised for DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicants maintained that the service instructions of DATE had given a detachment of carabinieri implicated in the death of PERSON a dynamic role , whereas it had previously been supposed to remain in one location . The Government stated that the service instructions had been communicated orally to the officers on the ground .

CARDINAL . A radio communications system had been put in place , with an operations control room located in the NORP police headquarters ( questura ) , which was in radio contact with the officers on the ground . The carabinieri and police officers could not communicate directly amongst themselves by radio ; they could only contact the control room .

CARDINAL . On TIME some groups of particularly aggressive demonstrators , wearing balaclavas and masks ( the “ LOC ” ) sparked numerous incidents and clashes with law - enforcement officers . The FAC march was due to set off from the ORG stadium . This was a demonstration involving several organisations : representatives of the “ No Global ” movement and of community centres , and young communists from the GPE comunista party . While they believed in non - violent protest ( civil disobedience ) , they had announced a strategic objective , namely to try to penetrate the red zone . On DATE the head of the Genoa police authority ( questore ) had prohibited the Tute Bianche march from entering the red zone or the zone adjacent to it , and had deployed lawenforcement officers to halt the march at FAC . Consequently , the demonstrators were able to march from the ORG stadium and all the way along PERSON to PERSON , that is to say , well beyond the junction of ORG and PERSON where clashes occurred , as detailed below .

CARDINAL . At around TIME the march set off and headed slowly westwards . Around PERSON there were signs of earlier disturbances . The march was headed by a contact group made up of politicians and a group of journalists carrying video recorders and cameras . The marchers slowed down and made a number of stops . In the vicinity of PERSON there were incidents involving persons wearing masks and balaclavas and lawenforcement officers . The march reached the railway tunnel at the junction with PERSON . Suddenly , tear gas was fired on the demonstrators by carabinieri under the command of Mr PERSON . The carabinieri charged forward , making use of their batons . The march was pushed back eastwards as far as the junction with PERSON .

CARDINAL . The demonstrators split up : some headed towards the seafront , while others sought refuge in PERSON and then in the area around PERSON . Some demonstrators responded to the attack by throwing hard objects such as glass bottles or rubbish bins at the law - enforcement officers . Armoured vehicles belonging to the carabinieri drove up Via Casaregis and PERSON at high speed , knocking down the barriers erected by the demonstrators and forcing the demonstrators at the scene to leave . At CARDINAL p.m. the control room ordered Mr ORG to move away and allow the marchers to pass .

CARDINAL . Some of the demonstrators retaliated with violence and clashes took place with the law - enforcement agencies . At around TIME a group of demonstrators attacked an armoured carabinieri van and set it alight .

CARDINAL . At TIME the presence of a group of demonstrators who appeared very aggressive was observed by the GPE battalion , consisting of CARDINAL carabinieri stationed close to ORG . CARDINAL Defender jeeps were parked nearby . Police officer PERSON ordered the carabinieri to charge the demonstrators . The carabinieri charged on foot , followed by the CARDINAL jeeps . The demonstrators succeeded in pushing back the charge , and the carabinieri were forced to withdraw in disorderly fashion near ORG . Pictures taken from a helicopter at TIME show the demonstrators running along ORG in pursuit of the lawenforcement officers .

CARDINAL . In view of the withdrawal of the carabinieri the jeeps attempted to reverse away from the scene . CARDINAL succeeded in moving off while the other found its exit blocked by an overturned refuse container . Suddenly , several demonstrators wielding stones , sticks and iron bars surrounded it . The CARDINAL side windows at the rear and the rear window of the jeep were smashed . The demonstrators shouted insults and threats at the jeep 's occupants and threw stones and a fire extinguisher at the vehicle .

CARDINAL . There were CARDINAL carabinieri on board the jeep : PERSON ( “ GPE ” ) , who was driving , PERSON ( “ LOC ” ) and PERSON ( “ D.R. ” ) . PERSON , who was suffering from the effects of the tear - gas grenades he had thrown during DATE , had been given permission by Captain PERSON , commander of a company of carabinieri , to get into the jeep in order to get away from the scene of the clashes . Crouched down in the back of the jeep , injured and panicking , he was protecting himself on CARDINAL side with a riot shield ( according to the statement of a demonstrator named Predonzani ) . Shouting at the demonstrators to leave “ or he would kill them ” , GPE drew his Beretta QUANTITY pistol , pointed it in the direction of the smashed rear window of the vehicle and , after TIME , fired CARDINAL shots .

CARDINAL . One of the shots struck PERSON , a balaclava - clad demonstrator , in the face under the left eye . He had been close to the rear of the jeep and had just picked an empty fire extinguisher off the ground and raised it up . He fell to the ground near the left - side rear wheel of the vehicle .

CARDINAL . Shortly afterwards , ORG managed to restart the engine and in an attempt to move off , reversed , driving over Carlo Giuliani 's body in the process . He then engaged first gear and drove over the body a second time as he left the scene . The jeep then drove towards PERSON .

CARDINAL . After “ QUANTITY ” , carabinieri sergeant - major PERSON got into the jeep and took over at the wheel , “ as the driver was in a state of shock ” . Another carabiniere named PERSON also got in .

CARDINAL . Police forces stationed on the other side of ORG intervened and dispersed the demonstrators . They were joined by some carabinieri . At TIME a police officer present at the scene called the control room to request an ambulance . A doctor who arrived at the scene subsequently pronounced PERSON dead .

CARDINAL . According to ORG ( ORG ) , it was impossible to indicate the exact number of carabinieri and police officers at the scene at the moment of PERSON death ; there had been CARDINAL carabinieri , QUANTITY from the jeep . In addition , QUANTITY away , near FAC , there had been a group of police officers .

CARDINAL . Relying , inter alia , on witness evidence given by law - enforcement officers during a parallel set of proceedings ( the “ trial of the CARDINAL ” , see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL below ) , the applicants stated in particular that , while on PERSON , the carabinieri had been able to take off their gas masks , eat and rest . With the situation “ calm ” , Captain PERSON had ordered GPE and GPE to board CARDINAL of the CARDINAL jeeps . He considered the QUANTITY carabinieri to be mentally exhausted ( “ a terra ” ) and no longer physically fit for duty . PERSON also considered that GPE should stop firing tear gas and took away his tear - gas gun and the pouch containing the tear - gas grenades .

CARDINAL . Referring to the photographs taken shortly before the fatal shot , the applicants stressed that the weapon had been held at a downward angle from the horizontal . They also referred to the statements made by ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , who said that he had been QUANTITY or so from PERSON and TIME away from the jeep . The carabinieri ( CARDINAL of them ) had been QUANTITY from the jeep . The police officers had been at DATE , towards PERSON . The applicants submitted that the photographs in the investigation file clearly showed some carabinieri not far from the jeep .

CARDINAL . A spent cartridge was found QUANTITY from FAC body . No bullet was found . A fire extinguisher and a bloodstained stone , among other objects , were found beside the body and were seized by the police . It emerges from the file that the public prosecutor 's office entrusted CARDINAL investigative measures to the police . The jeep in which GPE had been travelling , and also the weapon and equipment belonging to him , remained in the hands of the carabinieri and were subsequently seized under a court order . A spent cartridge was found inside the jeep .

CARDINAL . During TIME the LOC police unit heard evidence from CARDINAL police officers , PERSON and PERSON . On DATE Captain PERSON , who was in charge of the ECHO company , recounted the events of DATE and gave the names of the carabinieri who had been in the jeep . He said that he had heard no shots , probably because of his radio earpiece , his helmet and his gas mask , which reduced his hearing .

CARDINAL . On TIME and GPE were identified and examined by the ORG public prosecutor 's office on suspicion of intentional homicide . The interviews took place at the headquarters of the FAC carabinieri .

CARDINAL . M.P. was an auxiliary carabiniere assigned to Battalion no . CARDINAL ( GPE ) , and CARDINAL of the members of the ECHO company constituted for the purpose of the GCARDINAL summit . Together with CARDINAL other companies from different regions of GPE , the company formed part of the ORG , under the orders of Lieutenant - Colonel PERSON . The ECHO company was under the orders of Captain PERSON and his deputies PERSON and GPE , and was directed and coordinated by PERSON , a senior officer ( vice questore ) of the GPE police . Each of the CARDINAL companies was divided into CARDINAL detachments of CARDINAL men . The overall commander of the companies was Colonel PERSON .

CARDINAL . M.P. , who was born on CARDINAL DATE and began serving as a carabiniere on DATE , was DATE and DATE at the material time . He was trained in the use of grenades and had been deployed to fire tear gas . He stated that during the public - order operations he had been supposed to move around on foot with his detachment . Having fired several tear - gas grenades , he had felt a burning in his eyes and face and had asked Captain PERSON for permission to board a jeep . Shortly afterwards another carabiniere ( PERSON ) , who was injured , had joined him .

CARDINAL . M.P. said that he had been very frightened because of everything he had seen being thrown that DATE , and was particularly afraid that the demonstrators would throw Molotov cocktails . He explained that he had grown more afraid after being injured in the leg by a metal object and in the head by a stone . He had become aware that the jeep was under attack because of the stones being thrown and had thought that “ CARDINAL of demonstrators were surrounding the jeep ” , although he added that “ at the time [ he ] fired the shots , no one was in sight ” . He said he had been “ panicstricken ” . At some point he realised that his hand was gripping his pistol ; he thrust the hand carrying the weapon through the jeep 's rear window and , after TIME , fired CARDINAL shots . He maintained that he had not noticed Carlo Giuliani behind the jeep either before or after firing .

CARDINAL . GPE , the jeep 's driver , was born on DATE and had been serving as a carabiniere for DATE . At the material time he was DATE and DATE . He stated that he had been in an alleyway near FAC and had attempted to reverse towards the square because the detachment was being pushed back by the demonstrators . However , he had found his path blocked by a refuse container and his engine had stalled . He had concentrated on trying to move the jeep out while his colleagues inside the vehicle were shouting . As a result , he had not heard the shots . Lastly , he stated : “ I did not notice anyone on the ground because I was wearing a mask , which partly blocked my view ... and also because it is hard to see properly out the side of the vehicle . I reversed and felt no resistance ; actually , I felt the left wheel jolt and thought it must be a pile of rubbish , since the refuse container had been overturned . The only thought in my head was how to get out of that mess . ”

CARDINAL . D.R. , who was born on DATE , had been performing military service since DATE . At the material time he was DATE and DATE . He stated that he had been struck in the face and back by stones thrown by demonstrators and had started to bleed . He had tried to protect himself by covering his face , and GPE for his part had tried to shield him with his body . At that point , he could no longer see anything , but he could hear the shouting and the sound of blows and objects entering the jeep . He heard GPE shouting at their attackers to stop and leave , and then heard two shots .
CARDINAL . On DATE GPE , during questioning by the public prosecutor , confirmed his statement of DATE , adding that he had shouted to the demonstrators : “ Leave or I 'll kill you ! ” .

CARDINAL . Sergeant - Major PERSON , who was in the other jeep on Piazza Alimonda , said that he had noticed that the jeep in which GPE was travelling had its path blocked by a refuse container and was surrounded by a large number of demonstrators , “ certainly CARDINAL ” . The latter were throwing objects at the jeep . In particular , he saw CARDINAL demonstrator throw a fire extinguisher at the rear window . He heard shots and saw PERSON fall down . The jeep then drove twice over Carlo Giuliani 's body . Once the jeep had succeeded in leaving PERSON , he went over to it and saw that the driver had got out and , visibly shaken , was asking for help . The sergeant - major took over the driving seat and , noticing that GPE had a pistol in his hand , ordered him to replace the safety catch . He immediately thought that this was the weapon that had just fired the shots , but said nothing to GPE , who was injured and whose head was bleeding . The driver told him that he had heard shots while he was manoeuvring the jeep . The sergeant - major was not given any explanation as to the circumstances surrounding the decision to shoot and did not ask any questions on the subject .

CARDINAL . Carabiniere PERSON had gone over to the jeep on foot . He said that he had seen that the pistol was drawn and asked GPE if he had fired . GPE said that he had , without specifying whether he had fired into the air or in the direction of a particular demonstrator . GPE kept saying : “ They wanted to kill me , I do n't want to die ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor heard evidence from Captain PERSON , commander of the ECHO company ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . Captain PERSON stated that he had given GPE permission to board the jeep and had taken his tear - gas gun as GPE was experiencing difficulties . He stated subsequently ( at the “ trial of the twenty five ” , hearing of DATE ) that GPE had been physically unfit to continue on account of his mental state and nervous tension . Captain PERSON had then moved with his men – CARDINAL in DATE towards the corner of Piazza Alimonda and ORG . He was requested by police officer PERSON to proceed up ORG in the direction of ORG to assist the men engaged there in trying to push back the demonstrators . He said he had been puzzled by the request , given the number of men with him and their state of tiredness , but had nevertheless stationed them on ORG . The carabinieri were forced back by the demonstrators coming from ORG ; they initially withdrew in an orderly manner , and then in disorderly fashion . Mr PERSON did not realise that , when the carabinieri withdrew , they were being followed by the CARDINAL jeeps , as there was no “ operational reason ” for the vehicles to be there . The demonstrators dispersed only when the mobile police units stationed on the other side of Piazza Alimonda intervened . Only then did he observe a man wearing a balaclava lying on the ground , apparently seriously injured . Some of his men were wearing helmets equipped with video cameras which should make it possible to shed light on the sequence of events ; the video recordings were handed over to Colonel GPE .

CARDINAL . Lieutenant - Colonel Truglio , Captain PERSON 's superior officer , stated that he had stopped QUANTITY from ORG and TIME QUANTITY from the jeep , and had seen the jeep drive over a body lying on the ground .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON gave evidence to the public prosecutor . He stated that he had learnt of the change to the service instructions on TIME DATE . At the hearing of DATE during the “ trial of the CARDINAL ” , he stated that he had been informed on DATE that no march was authorised for DATE . On DATE he had still been unaware that an authorised march was due to take place . During DATE he went to PERSON , where clashes were taking place with demonstrators . At TIME , while the situation was calm , Lieutenant - Colonel PERSON and the CARDINAL jeeps joined the contingent . TIME and TIME the contingent was involved in clashes on PERSON . It then arrived in the vicinity of PERSON and ORG . Lieutenant - Colonel PERSON and the CARDINAL jeeps came back and the contingent was reorganised . Mr PERSON observed a group of demonstrators at the end of ORG who had formed a barrier using wheeled refuse containers and were advancing towards the law - enforcement officers . He asked Captain PERSON whether his men were in a position to deal with the situation and the latter replied in the affirmative . Mr PERSON and the contingent therefore took up positions close to ORG . He heard an order to withdraw and took part in the disorderly withdrawal of the contingent .

CARDINAL . Some demonstrators present at the time of the events also gave statements to the public prosecutor . Some of them said they had been very close to the jeep and had themselves thrown stones and had struck the jeep with sticks and other objects . According to CARDINAL demonstrator , GPE had cried : “ Bastards , I 'm going to kill the lot of you ! ” . Another noticed that the carabiniere inside the jeep had taken out his pistol ; the demonstrator then shouted to his friends to watch out and moved away . Another demonstrator said that GPE had been protecting himself on CARDINAL side with a riot shield .

CARDINAL . Some individuals who witnessed the events from the windows of their homes said they had seen a demonstrator pick up a fire extinguisher and raise it up . They had heard CARDINAL shots and had seen the demonstrator fall to the ground .

CARDINAL . The public prosecutor 's office ordered the law - enforcement agencies to hand over any audiovisual material which might help in reconstructing the events on ORG . Photographs had been taken and video recordings made by film crews , helicopter cameras and miniature video cameras in the helmets of some of the officers . Pictures taken by private individuals were also available .

CARDINAL . Within TIME the public prosecutor 's office ordered an autopsy to establish the cause of PERSON death . On DATE at TIME notice of the autopsy – specifying that the injured party could appoint an expert and a lawyer – was served on the first applicant , PERSON father . At TIME Mr Canale and PERSON , the experts appointed by the prosecuting authorities , were given their official brief and work commenced on the autopsy . The applicants did not send any representative or expert of their own .

CARDINAL . The experts requested the public prosecutor 's office to give them DATE to prepare their report . The request was granted . On DATE the public prosecutor 's office authorised the cremation of PERSON body in accordance with the family 's wishes .

CARDINAL . The expert report was submitted on DATE . It found that PERSON had been struck below the left eye by a bullet which had passed through the skull and exited through the rear of the skull on the left . The bullet 's trajectory had been as follows : it had been fired from a distance exceeding QUANTITY and had travelled from front to back , from right to left and in a downward direction . PERSON had been QUANTITY tall . The person firing the shot had been facing the victim and slightly to his right . According to the experts , the bullet injury to the head had resulted in death within TIME ; the jeep 's being driven over the body had caused only insignificant minor injuries to the organs in the thorax and the abdomen .

CARDINAL . After leaving PERSON the CARDINAL carabinieri who had been in the jeep went to the casualty department of ORG . GPE complained of diffuse bruising to his right leg and an injury to the skull with open wounds ; against the advice of the doctors , who wished to admit him , PERSON signed a discharge and left the hospital at TIME He had an injury to the skull which , he said , had been caused by a blow to the head with a blunt instrument while he had been in the jeep .

CARDINAL . D.R. presented with bruising and abrasions to the nose and the right cheekbone and bruises on the left shoulder and left foot . GPE was suffering from a posttraumatic psychological disorder and was expected to recover within DATE .

CARDINAL . Medical examinations were carried out to establish the nature of the injuries and their connection with the attack on the jeep 's occupants . The reports concluded that the injuries sustained by GPE and PERSON had not been life - threatening . PERSON 's head injuries could have been caused by a stone thrown at him , but it was not possible to determine the origin of his other injuries . The injury to PERSON 's face could have been caused by a stone thrown at him and his shoulder injury by a blow from a wooden plank .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor 's office instructed Mr ORG to establish whether the CARDINAL spent cartridges found at the scene ( one in the jeep and the other QUANTITY from FAC body – see paragraph CARDINAL above ) had come from the same weapon , and specifically from ORG 's weapon . In his report of DATE the expert concluded that there was a PERCENT probability that the cartridge found in the jeep had come from GPE 's pistol , whereas there was only a PERCENT probability that the cartridge found close to PERSON body had issued from the same weapon . In accordance with LAW ( “ the ORG ” ) , these tests were carried out unilaterally , that is to say , without the injured party having an opportunity to participate .

CARDINAL . NORP The public prosecutor 's office appointed a second expert , police inspector PERSON . The latter , in a report submitted on DATE , stated that there was a PERCENT probability that the spent cartridge found near the victim 's body had come from GPE 's weapon . He concluded that both the cartridges had come from GPE 's pistol , and estimated the distance between GPE and Carlo Giuliani at the moment of impact at QUANTITY . The tests were conducted unilaterally .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor 's office instructed a panel of experts ( made up of Mr PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON ) “ to reconstruct , even in virtual form , the actions of GPE and PERSON in the moments immediately before and after the bullet struck the victim 's body ” . In particular , the experts were asked to “ establish the distance between GPE and PERSON , their respective angles of vision and PERSON 's field of vision inside the jeep at the moment the shots were fired ” . It appears from the file that PERSON had published an article in DATE in a specialist journal ( ORG ) , in which he expressed the view , among other things , that ORG 's actions had constituted “ a clear and wholly justified defensive reaction ” .

CARDINAL . NORP The representatives and experts appointed by the applicants attended the examinations by the panel of experts . The applicants ' lawyer , PERSON , stated that he did not wish to make an application for the immediate production of evidence ( incidente probatorio ) . LAW ( f ) and CARDINAL of the ORG allows the public prosecutor and the accused , among other things , to request the investigating judge ( giudice per le indagini preliminari ) to order a forensic examination where the latter concerns a person , object or place which is subject to unavoidable alteration or where , if ordered during the trial , the examination in question could entail suspension of the proceedings for DATE . Under LAW ORG the injured party may request the public prosecutor to apply for the immediate production of evidence . If the public prosecutor refuses the request , he or she must issue an order giving reasons and must serve it on the injured party .
CARDINAL . An on - site inspection was conducted on DATE . Traces of the impact of a shot were found on the wall of a building on PERSON , at a height of QUANTITY .

CARDINAL . On DATE the experts submitted their report . The experts stated at the outset that the fact that they had not had access to PERSON body ( because it had been cremated ) had been a major obstacle which had prevented them from producing an exhaustive report , as they had been unable to re - examine parts of the body and search for micro - traces . On the basis of the “ little material available ” the experts attempted to establish first of all what the impact of the bullet had been on PERSON body , setting out the following considerations .

CARDINAL . The injuries to the skull had been very serious and had resulted in death “ within a short space of time ” . The bullet had not exited whole from Carlo Giuliani 's head ; the report ( referto radiologico ) of the full body scan performed before the autopsy referred to a “ subcutaneous fragment , probably metal ” above the bones in the occipital region . This piece of opaque metal looked like a fragment of bullet casing . The appearance of the entry wound on the face did not lend itself to an unequivocal interpretation ; its irregular shape was explained chiefly by the type of tissue in the part of the body struck by the bullet . However , CARDINAL possible explanation was that the bullet had not hit Carlo Giuliani directly , but had encountered an intermediate object which could have distorted it and slowed it down before it reached the victim 's body . That hypothesis would explain the small dimensions of the exit wound and the fact that the bullet had fragmented inside Carlo Giuliani 's head .

CARDINAL . The experts reported finding a small fragment of lead , probably from the bullet , which had come off PERSON balaclava when the latter was being handled ; it was impossible to ascertain whether the fragment had come from the front , side or back of the balaclava . It bore traces of a substance which was not part of the bullet as such , but came from material used in the building industry . In addition , micro - fragments of lead were found on the front and back of the balaclava , apparently confirming the hypothesis that the bullet had lost part of its casing at the moment of impact . According to the experts , it was not possible to establish the nature of the “ intermediate object ” apparently hit by the bullet ; however , they ruled out the possibility that it was the fire extinguisher which Carlo Giuliani had been holding in his outstretched hand . The distance from which the shot had been fired had been in excess of QUANTITY .

CARDINAL . In order to reconstruct the events on the basis of the “ intermediate object theory ” , the experts then had some test shots fired and conducted video and computer simulations . They concluded that it was not possible to establish the bullet 's trajectory as the latter had undoubtedly been altered as a result of the collision . On the basis of video footage showing a stone disintegrating in the air and of the shot that could be heard on the soundtrack , the experts concluded that the stone had shattered immediately after the shot had been fired . A computer simulation showed the bullet , fired upwards , hitting PERSON after colliding with the stone in question , thrown at the jeep by another demonstrator . The experts estimated that the distance between Carlo Giuliani and the jeep had been QUANTITY and that GPE had been able to see PERSON at the moment the shot was fired .

CARDINAL . The applicants submitted a statement made to their lawyer by PERSON , CARDINAL of the demonstrators , on DATE . PERSON stated in particular that Carlo Giuliani had still been alive after the jeep had driven over his body . The applicants also produced a statement made by a carabiniere ( V.M. ) , who reported a widespread practice among law - enforcement officers consisting in altering bullets of the kind used by GPE in order to increase their capacity to expand and hence fragment .

CARDINAL . Lastly , the applicants submitted CARDINAL reports drawn up by experts they themselves had chosen . According to CARDINAL of the experts , PERSON , the bullet had already been in fragments when it struck the victim . The fact that it had fragmented could be explained by a manufacturing defect or by its having been manipulated to make it more likely to break up . In the expert 's view , however , these CARDINAL scenarios occurred only rarely and were therefore less likely than the CARDINAL advanced by the prosecuting authorities ' experts ( namely that the bullet had collided with an intermediate object ) .

CARDINAL . The other experts appointed by the applicants to reconstruct the events concluded that the stone had shattered on impact with the jeep rather than with the bullet fired by ORG .. In order to reconstruct the events on the basis of the audiovisual material , and especially of the photographs , it was necessary to establish the exact position of the photographer , and in particular his or her angle of vision , taking into account also the type of equipment used . In addition , it was necessary to establish the timing of the images and how they fitted in with the sound . The applicants ' experts criticised the method used by the prosecuting authorities ' experts , who had based their analysis on “ video and computer simulations ” and had not analysed the available images rigorously and in detail . The method used to perform the test shots was also criticised .

CARDINAL . The applicants ' experts concluded that PERSON had been QUANTITY away from the jeep when the shot was fired . While it was undeniable that the fatal bullet had been in fragments when it struck the victim , the possibility of its having collided with the stone which could be seen in the video should be ruled out . A stone would have distorted the bullet differently and left different marks on Carlo Giuliani 's body . Moreover , PERSON had not fired upwards .

CARDINAL . On completion of the domestic investigation the NORP public prosecutor decided to request that the case against GPE and GPE be discontinued . The public prosecutor noted first of all that far - reaching changes had been made to the organisation of the public - order operations on TIME DATE , and took the view that this partly explained the problems that had arisen on DATE . However , he did not detail the changes or the problems that had resulted .

DATE . The ORG is concerned at the number of reports of ill - treatment by law enforcement agencies , the limited number of investigations carried out by ORG in such cases , and the very limited number of convictions in those cases which are investigated . The ORG notes with concern that the offence of torture , which as such does not exist in the NORP LAW but rather is punishable under other provisions of LAW , might in some cases be subject to the statute of limitations . ORG is of the view that acts of torture can not be subject to any statute of limitations and it welcomes the statement made by ORG delegation that it is considering a modification of the time limitations ( arts . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE and DATE ) .
ORG recommends that ORG should :

( a ) Strengthen its measures to ensure prompt , impartial and effective investigations into all allegations of torture and ill - treatment committed by law enforcement officials . In particular , such investigations should not be undertaken by or under the authority of the police , but by an independent body . In connection with prima facie cases of torture and ill - treatment , the suspect should as a rule be subject to suspension or reassignment during the process of investigation , especially if there is a risk that he or she might impede the investigation ;

( b ) Try the perpetrators and impose appropriate sentences on those convicted in order to eliminate impunity for law enforcement personnel who are responsible for violations prohibited by the LAW ; and

( c ) ORG its rules and provisions on the statute of limitations and bring them fully in line with its obligations under the Convention so that acts of torture as well as attempts to commit torture and acts by any person which constitute complicity or participation in torture , can be investigated , prosecuted and punished without time limitations . ”
